body.p:
At the NewarkConference of the N.A.C.P.National Association For The Advancement Of Colored People, re-
cently, CongressmanDyersaid, that if one million colored
people and white people got together and decide Lynching would
go, as well as otherundemocratinundemocraticthings against the negro.

Following this Convention, sixteen colored
women from five states formed themselves into a voluntary
Executive Committee-Anti-Lynching-Crusadersand decided to put on
an intense campaign for the purpose of uniting one million women
white and black to end lynching, mob violence and other undemo-
cratic practices against ourselves.

This Committee met again Saturday ,
and entered into an organization and decided to begin work. They
believed that one million women could be united, and they also,
believed that one million dollars could be raised.

By unanimous vote, I was elected National Directorof this Campaign. I am writing you to see if you will
join in with us. I want you to be State Directorof your State.
As State Director, your duties will be outlined.

We have decided upon the month of Augustfor
organization--Septemberfor instruction and October for a reali-
zation of our intensive work.

The million dollars is not the big thing, but
the prayers of a million women united to do God's work. This
is to be a Campaign of prayer and self sacrifice. WontWon't you join
in with us?

If you will act as State Director, please
communicate with me at once. Your first duty will be to send
me the name and address of a Key Woman in every city and town
in your State. If there are factions, - appoint two Key Women--
for once, let us get together. This Campaign means to unite
every fraternal and church woman--every one of us must be united
into one big sisterhood.

Letters of instruction will follow your ac-
ceptance. This is to be the biggest campaign ever untaken by
colored women. Our object is to place money into the legistla-
tion now being carried on by the N.A.A.C.P.National Association For The Advancement Of Colored People, to end lynching
and mob violence. We want to get out our stationary with your
name as State Director.
Lose no time in answering this letter.
